alert.note: Alert for Benton; Hickory; St. Clair (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued July 12 at 11:27PM CDT until July 13 at 12:15AM CDT by NWS Springfield
info.description: The National Weather Service in Springfield has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Hickory County in central Missouri... Southwestern Benton County in central Missouri... Eastern St. Clair County in west central Missouri... * Until 1215 AM CDT. * At 1127 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Osceola, or 15 miles northwest of Hermitage, moving southeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Pomme de Terre Lake, Truman Lake, Pomme De Terre State Park, Pittsburg, Osceola, Hermitage, Weaubleau, Wheatland, Preston, Cross Timbers, Collins, Vista, Gerster, Quincy, Elkton, Harper, Fristoe, Iconium, Edwards and Nemo. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
